snippet.textDisplay: I’m in Shanghai now and though most of the footages above i cant see on our web, i believe they are valid. I‘m a business owner myself and from what i can tell, 40-60% of small businesses will perish if the quarantine last longer than a month from now. We have to continue paying our rent, and salaries/social securities to our employees. 1) Government mandates firms like us to pay at least minimal salaries to our staffs(¥2590+ss¥1628). Laying off staffs is the last option if the company quenches its cashflow. 2) Government indeed gives order to SOC to exempt firms rent for 6 months but in reality, SOCs are using private companies to sign contracts with us tenants.
snippet.textOriginal: I’m in Shanghai now and though most of the footages above i cant see on our web, i believe they are valid. I‘m a business owner myself and from what i can tell, 40-60% of small businesses will perish if the quarantine last longer than a month from now. We have to continue paying our rent, and salaries/social securities to our employees. 1) Government mandates firms like us to pay at least minimal salaries to our staffs(¥2590+ss¥1628). Laying off staffs is the last option if the company quenches its cashflow. 2) Government indeed gives order to SOC to exempt firms rent for 6 months but in reality, SOCs are using private companies to sign contracts with us tenants.

snippet.textDisplay: I am in Melbourne Australia and we had a lot of lockdowns. Although we were allowed to go grocery shopping. we have been out of lockdowns for a while now but so many businesses have closed as a result. It is heart breaking that they are the ones to suffer but the big stores are the ones to survive. I wish you all the best and hope that you find your way through with your business intact and that lockdown does not go on much longer.
